Post-Match Reflections: Pat Murphy said, 'We were doing our show and I watched it with him. What's better than that? Awesome.'
First baseman Rhys Hoskins said, 'Nobody wants it to be easy, let’s just be honest. Everybody that’s in that room cherishes challenges.'

Yelich said, 'We were all kind of written off, right? So that makes this one kind of special because we found a way. We faced a lot of adversity. We believed in each other. We came together as a group and got it done.'
Murphy said, 'You can do all that to us, but it’s still about people, and you have no idea what their best is.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Milwaukee Brewers clinched their third NL Central title in the last four years.
Jake Bauers' ninth-inning RBI single gave the Brewers a 2-1 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies.
The Brewers' clubhouse emptied of players with one out to go in the ninth inning in Chicago, a couple of hours before Milwaukee's scheduled first pitch against Philadelphia.
Blue-and-gold streamers fell into the American Family Field stands as the team gathered in shallow center field to celebrate.
